The Virginia General Assembly could expand voter access in 2020 by passing same-day voter registration.
 ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌  ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌ ‌

Tell your lawmakers to pass same-day voter registration.

Voter registration deadlines don't make sense. It's time to drop this barrier to the ballot box.

EMAIL YOUR LAWMAKER

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

Voting is the cornerstone of our democracy. And yet, arbitrary voter registration deadlines keep hundreds of thousands of Virginians from the ballot box.

We're calling on the Virginia General Assembly to pass same-day voter registration when they convene in January.

Let your lawmakers know you support this effort.

Right now, Virginia is the second-hardest state in the nation to cast your ballot, in part because of unnecessary registration deadlines that disproportionately affect marginalized communities. Same-day voter registration would get rid of this restrictive barrier. Online registration and e-pollbooks are standard technologies, making same-day registration an easy way to expand access to voting.

Nineteen other states have same-day voter registration, and their voter turnout increased 7-10 percent on average because of it. It's time for Virginia to drop this useless restriction.

Tell your lawmakers you support same-day voter registration.

Thanks for being with us.

ACLU of Virginia
